adyen_getting_started.label: Documentation & Support
adyen_getting_started.comment:
• Visit the Magento Integration Manual
  • The latest version of the Adyen Magento module is also available through GitHub.

In the test mode you need to use test cards. Test cards can be found here

In the test mode you can test with refused cards. For more information click here

The Adyen back-office can be found on https://ca-test.adyen.com for test or https://ca-live.adyen.com for live.

Already visited the Magento Integration Manual but still have questions? Please contact us at magento@adyen.com.

merchantAccount.label: Merchant Account
merchantAccount.tooltip: The merchant account identifier you want to process the (transaction) request with. Find this at the top of the screen in the Adyen Customer Area, where you will see [YourCompanyAccount] > [YourMerchantAccount] . Please note that the merchant account is different from the company account; a company account can have one or more merchant accounts.

demoMode.label: Test/Production Mode
demoMode.tooltip: In the test mode you must use test cards. See section Documentation & Support for the link to the test cards

notification_username.label: Notification User Name
notification_username.tooltip: Set a user name of your choice here and copy it over to Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Server Communication => Standard Notification => User Name.

notification_password.label: Notification Password
notification_password.tooltip: Set a password of your choice and copy it over to Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Server Communication => Standard Notification => Password.

ws_username_test.label: Test: Web Service User Name
ws_username_test.tooltip: Find this in your Test Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System. Normally this will be ws@Company.YourCompanyAccount. Copy and Paste the exact ws user name here.

ws_password_test.label: Test: Web Service Password
ws_password_test.tooltip: Find this in your Test Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System. Click on your web service user and generate a new password. Copy and Paste the exact password here.

ws_test_button.button_label: Test Web Service Credentials for test

ws_username_live.label: Live: Web Service User Name
ws_username_live.tooltip: This is only applicable if you have a Live account. Find this in your Live Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System. Normally this will be ws@Company.YourCompanyAccount. Copy and Paste the exact ws user name here.

ws_password_live.label: Live: Web Service Password
Live: Web Service Password
ws_password_live.tooltip: This is only applicable if you have a Live account. Find this in your Live Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System. Click on your web service user and generate a new password. Copy and Paste the exact password here.

ws_live_button.button_label: Test Web Service Credentials for live

capture_mode.label: Capture Delay
capture_mode.tooltip: Immediate is the default. Set to manual if you want to perform the capture of funds manually later (only affects credit cards and a few alternative payment methods). You need to change this setting as well in Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Merchant Settings => Capture Delay. If you have selected a capture delay of a couple of days in Adyen keep it here on immediate

order_status.label: Order status: order creation
order_status.tooltip: Status given to newly created orders before payment result confirmation via server notifications from Adyen.

payment_pre_authorized.label: Order status: payment authorisation
payment_pre_authorized.tooltip: Status given to orders after authorisation confirmed by an AUTHORISATION notification from Adyen. Note: an authorisation status via the result URL does not yet trigger this status.

payment_authorized.label: Order status: payment confirmed
payment_authorized.tooltip: Status given to orders after capture result is confirmed by an AUTHORISATION notification (if capture mode = immediate) or a CAPTURE notification (if capture mode = manual capture) from Adyen.

payment_cancelled.label: Order status: order cancellation
payment_cancelled.tooltip: Status given to orders after order cancellation is confirmed by a AUTHORIZATION with success false, CANCEL OR CANCEL_OR_REFUND notification from Adyen. If orders are already invoiced, they cannot be cancelled, but will be refunded instead.

paypal_capture_mode.label: Use manual capture for PayPal
paypal_capture_mode.tooltip: Should be on 'No' by default. If you have requested with Adyen Support for your PayPal integration to be on manual capture, set this to 'Yes'.

auto_capture_openinvoice.label: Use auto-capture for OpenInvoice payments
auto_capture_openinvoice.tooltip: Applicable for Klarna and AfterPay only. By default OpenInvoice is set to manual capture. If you want auto capture you need to contact magento@adyen.com. After approval has been given, then you can set this option to 'Yes'.

payment_authorized_virtual.label: Order status: payment capture (virtual products)
payment_authorized_virtual.tooltip: (optional) Select only status assigned to state complete. Leave empty to use the same as normal products

refund_authorized.label: Order status: Adyen Refunded
refund_authorized.tooltip: Status given to order after a refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received

refund_partial_authorized.label: Order status: Adyen partial Refunded
refund_partial_authorized.tooltip: Status given to order after a partial refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received. We advise to don't set this status and let Magento decide the status

pending_status.label: Order status: pending Bank Transfer/SEPA orders
pending_status.tooltip: By default, Adyen does not inform your Magento store about pending payments. If you want these notifications to be received, Go to Adyen Customer Area => Server Communication and add BankTransfer Pending Notification and Direct-Debit Pending Notification.

send_email_bank_sepa_on_pending.label: Send order confirmation email for Bank Transfer/SEPA
send_email_bank_sepa_on_pending.tooltip: Send a confirmation mail after Bank Tranfer/SEPA is placed (not yet paid). If you want these notifications to be received, Go to Adyen Customer Area => Server Communication and add BankTransfer Pending Notification and Direct-Debit Pending Notification.

create_pending_invoice.label: Create a pending invoice (only for manual capture)
create_pending_invoice.tooltip: This will create a pending invoice if the AUTHORISATION notification is received. Note: this will cause Magento to push all orders to Status:'Processing' once the invoice is created, ignoring all other settings.

capture_on_shipment.label: Order status: Capture on shipment
capture_on_shipment.tooltip: If you enable this function it will do a capture request to Adyen if you do a shipment.

uncancelorder.label: Enable Uncancel Order
uncancelorder.tooltip: If an order is cancelled for some reason but it received a notification that the payment is authorised this will automatically uncancel the order

unholdorder.label: Enable Unhold Order
unholdorder.tooltip: If an order is holded for some reason but it received a notification that the payment is processed this will automatically unhold the order

autorefundoncancel.label: Automatic cancel\refund when a order is canceled
autorefundoncancel.tooltip: Enable/Disable automatic refund when canceling a order.

send_update_mail.label: Customers receive order status update email (deprecated).
send_update_mail.tooltip: Enable/Disable update mails for all order status changes to the shopper.

use_zero_auth.label: Do not perform a full authorisation, only a zero auth to check if the card is valid

base_zero_auth_on_date.label: Base zero authentication vs. full authentication on the date field
base_zero_auth_on_date.tooltip: Full authentication is only valid for 7 days, after that it expires. The value here should be the date column name in 'sales_flat_order' on which the order will be shipped and thus captured.

ignore_refund_notification.label: Ignore refund notification
ignore_refund_notification.tooltip: If the refund is done on the Adyen Platform it will send a refund notification to Magento which automatically creates a credit memo. If you set this setting to 'Yes', this will not happen because it will not process any of the REFUND notification that is received.

multiple_merchants.label: Allow multiple merchants
multiple_merchants.tooltip: Allow notifications sent from other Adyen merchant accounts. Keep in mind that the Notification user name and password should be the same for all the merchant accounts

event_queue_limit.label: Process Notification Queue Limit
event_queue_limit.tooltip: What is the maximum amount of payment notifications to process during a cron run?

adyen_billing_agreements.label: Advanced: Billing Agreements
adyen_billing_agreements.comment:
ONECLICK: The shopper opts in to storing their card details for future use. The shopper is present for the subsequent transaction, for cards the security code (CVC/CVV) is required.

RECURRING*: Payment details are stored for future use. For cards, the security code (CVC/CVV) is not required for subsequent payments.

ONECLICK, RECURRING*: Payment details are stored for future use. This allows the use of the stored payment details regardless of whether the shopper is on your site or not.

* keep in mind you need the recurring permission enabled. You can contact magento@adyen.com to enable this for your account.

recurringtypes.label: Agreement Type
recurringtypes.tooltip: When enabled, users can save their Credit Cards and their SEPA authorizations. ONECLICK will require the input of the CVC for subsequent payments, while RECURRING does not.

payment_cancelled_redirect.label: Redirect destination after cancellation
payment_cancelled_redirect.tooltip: Determines how shoppers get redirected after they cancel a payment.

title_renderer.label: Payment method render method
title_renderer.tooltip: Determines whether the payment methods will be displayed with its logo or just the name.

shopperlocale.label: Language locale (optional)
shopperlocale.tooltip: This will override the default shopper locale of the Magento store (e.g. nl_NL). Leave empty to let Magento decide.

countryCode.label: ISO Country Code (optional)
countryCode.tooltip: This will override the shopper billing address country when determining what payment methods to display.

adyen_manual_review.label: Advanced: Manual Review
adyen_manual_review.comment: Adyen's Risk analysis tool allows merchants to configure when a transaction should be rejected or accepted depending on certain characteristics of the payment. This process has always had two automatic outcomes, either accept or reject the payment. Now, Adyen's risk system can tell merchants when a transaction seems to be risky but without rejecting it, and requires to be manually reviewed in order to decide if it should be accepted or rejected. If you want this to be turned on please contact magento@adyen.com

fraud_manual_review_status.label: Manual Review Status
fraud_manual_review_status.tooltip: This status will be triggered when Adyen notifies your Magento module that the payment has come under Manual Review. If you do not have this set up or do not want a separate status, please keep it on the default (e.g.'— Please Select —').

fraud_manual_review_accept_status.label: Manual Review Accepted Status
fraud_manual_review_accept_status.tooltip: Only relevant if you do not have an action defined when you accept a manual review. This status will be triggered when a 'MANUAL_REVIEW_ACCEPT' notification is received from Adyen. If you have already asked Adyen to set an action for this (e.g. capture) or don't want a separate status for this, please keep it on the default (e.g.'— Please Select —')

adyen_split_payments.label: Advanced: Split Payments
adyen_split_payments.comment: It is possible to do split payments with GiftCards please configure here what refund strategie you want to use

split_payments_refund_strategy.label: Refund Strategy
split_payments_refund_strategy.tooltip: Only relevant if you accept giftcards on Adyen platform

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

cse_enabled.label: Enable Client-Side Encryption (CSE)
cse_enabled.tooltip: Contact support@adyen.com to enable CSE permission on your Adyen account. If you want this to be turned on on your live account please fill in the SAQ-A form and send this to salessupport@adyen.com
cse_enabled.comment: Click here to download the SAQ A form

cse_publickey_test.label: Enter CSE Public Key of Test Adyen Web Service User
cse_publickey_test.tooltip: Copy this from the Test Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System => [web service user]=> Client Encryption Public Key.

cse_publickey.label: Enter CSE Public Key of Live Adyen Web Service User
cse_publickey.tooltip: Copy this from the Live Adyen Customer Area => Settings => Users => System => [web service user] => Client Encryption Public Key.

visible_type.label: Visible in
visible_type.tooltip: Determine the visibility of this payment method in the frontend and/or backend of Magento.

enable_moto.label: Enable MOTO for backend orders
enable_moto.tooltip: Important you have to activate MOTO for your account contact magento@adyen.com. For more information check our MOTO manual

installments.label: Installments default
installments.comments: This is the fallback if specific credit card type has no installments configured

disable_zero_total.label: Disable at zero grand total
disable_zero_total.tooltip: Disable this payment method in the checkout when the grand total of the quote is 0.

adyen_oneclick.label: Stored Payment Methods - Requires Adyen Credit Card
adyen_oneclick.comment:
During checkout shoppers can choose to have their payment details remembered and stored for trusted websites in Adyen’s highly secure platform. Adyen takes care of this process for its customers. Shoppers can then select the stored payment method in the checkout.
Make sure you have turned on RECURRING_CONTRACT notification on your merchantAccount. If you want to add this or if you are not sure, just send us an email.

active.label: Enabled
active.tooltip: OneClick payments only work if you have Adyen Credit Card enabled

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

recurring_payment_type.label: Agreement Type
recurring_payment_type.tooltip: With ONECLICK the shopper needs to fill in their security code for credit cards. For RECURRING, this is not needed. If you want to use RECURRING make sure you have Agreement Type set to RECURRING or ONECLICK,RECURRING. In the Backend always recurring is used because OneClick could trigger 3D secure.

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

skinCode.label: Skin Code
skinCode.tooltip: Copy and paste the skin code of the skin you want to use from Test Customer Area => Skins.

secret_wordt.label: HMAC Key for Test
secret_wordt.tooltip: Copy and paste the HMAC key of the skin you want to use from Test Customer Area => Skins. => click on [skin code] => Edit => HMAC for Test platform. Only the SHA-256 HMAC calculation method is supported in this plugin. SHA-1 is deprecate and will not be supported by Adyen.

secret_wordp.label: HMAC Key for Live
secret_wordp.tooltip: Copy and paste the HMAC key of the skin you want to use from Test Customer Area => Skins. => click on [skin code] => Edit => HMAC for Live platform. Only the SHA-256 HMAC calculation method is supported in this plugin. SHA-1 is deprecate and will not be supported by Adyen.

delivery_days.label: Days to Delivery
delivery_days.tooltip: How many days to be added to the current date for delivery. ONLY whole numbers allowed.

disable_hpptypes.label: Leave payment method selection on HPP
disable_hpptypes.tooltip: If you set this to 'Yes', payment methods in the checkout won't be displayed and you will be redirected to the Adyen HPP to make the selection.

payment_routines.label: Payment Flow Selection
payment_routines.tooltip: Adyen provides you with 2 types of payment routines. The Single-Page flow is dynamic and contains card validation and animations powered by JavaScript. The Multi-Page flow is static, but performs better on older browsers.

return_url_in_request.label: Return URL in request
return_url_in_request.tooltip: Set to 'Yes' by default. Sending the return URL in the payment request allows a single skin to also be used by multiple store views. Set to 'No' if you want to manually set which URL the shopper redirects to under Test Adyen Customer => Skins => Edit => Result URLs.

disable_zero_total.label: Disable at zero grand total
disable_zero_total.tooltip: Disable this payment method in the checkout when the grand total of the quote is 0.

show_ideal_logos.label: Show iDEAL bank logos
show_ideal_logos.tooltip: Show iDEAL bank logos (radio buttons) instead of in a drop-down list.

autoselect_stored_ideal_bank.label: Auto select Ideal bank
autoselect_stored_ideal_bank.tooltip: If you have problems that the wrong ideal bank is selected turn this option off. This is a common problem in the onestepcheckout module

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

shoppertype.label: Allow Shopper information to be changed on HPP

different_address_disable.label: Disable on different billing and delivery addresses
different_address_disable.tooltip: Klarna will probably reject payments which have differing billing and delivery addresses. Setting this to 'Yes' will disable this payment method when that is the case.

failed_attempt_disable.label: Disable this payment method if first attempt is refused
failed_attempt_disable.tooltip: If the first attempt is refused, don't show this as an payment option for the current quote.

ignore_second_address_field.label: Ignore the second address line field
ignore_second_address_field.tooltip: If you do not want to send the second line address field to Klarna set this setting to 'Yes'

ratepay_id.label: RatePAY Device Ident SId
ratepay_id.tooltip: Unique RatePAY Id provided by RatePAY integration consultant

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

validate_iban.label: Validate IBAN
validate_iban.tooltip: This is a basic validation on the IBAN number.

flow.label: Flow
flow.tooltip: If you are not sure just leave it at 'Sale’. Sale means it is always immidiate capture with auth/cap it will follow the Capture Delay. If you want to enable 'Auth/Capt' for SEPA Direct Debit, please contact support@adyen.com

visible_type.tooltip: Where do you want to show this payment method in the backend of Magento or in the frontend for the shoppers

sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

use_taxvat.tooltip: If you use taxvat for the CPF/CNPJ field you can then enable this option to auto fill in the Social Security Number

order_underpaid_status.label: Order status underpaid
order_underpaid_status.tooltip: With Boleto it is possible to pay less than the full amount. Select here the status if this is the case. If you leave this empty it will take the Order status authorised payment as default status

order_overpaid_status.label: Order status overpaid
order_overpaid_status.tooltip: With Boleto it is possible to pay more than the total amount. Select here the status if this is the case. If you leave this empty it will take the Order status authorised payment as default status

sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

recurringtypes.label: Agreement Type
recurringtypes.tooltip: You can set different value for POS because you have to have the permission of the customer

add_receipt_order_lines.label: Add orderlines to receipt
add_receipt_order_lines.tooltip: If you have the Adyen App configured to print to an external printer the orderlines can be printed on to the receipt if you turn this option on.

enable_scanner.label: Enable Scanner
enable_scanner.tooltip: If you enable this you have the possibility to scan products with a hand scanner on the shopping cart page and this will automatically add products to the shopping cart based on the same SKU name.

auto_submit_scanner.label: Auto submit scanner
auto_submit_scanner.tooltip: If you have a scanner that puss a enter command after scanning turn this setting on.

express_checkout.label: Express checkout
express_checkout.tooltip: This will show a checkout button on the shopping cart to directly do a POS payment without going to the checkout steps. You must be logged into your Magento account on the front-end to see the button.

express_checkout_kiosk_mode.label: Kiosk mode
express_checkout_kiosk_mode.tooltip: If you turn kiosk modus on it will not auto-complete the customers based on the filled in email address

express_checkout_recurring.label: Show Recurring Cards
express_checkout_recurring.tooltip: This will show the recurring cards beneath the express checkout and makes it possible to do a recurring online payment by clicking on the card

create_shipment.label: Create Shipment
create_shipment.tooltip: If you enable this there will be automatically be created a shipment if the invoice is created

ip_filter.label: IP filter
ip_filter.tooltip: Enable IP filter let's you define an IP range when this payment method is visible

cash_drawer_printer_ip.label: IP address printer
cash_drawer_printer_ip.tooltip: Enter here the IP address of the printer where the cash drawer is connected to

cash_drawer_printer_port.label: Printer port

cash_drawer_printer_device_id.label: Printer Device ID
cash_drawer_printer_device_id.tooltip: Enter here the deviceID of the printer where the cash drawer is connected to

adyen_apple_pay.label: Apple Pay
adyen_apple_pay.comment:
You need to configure Apple Pay on the Adyen Platform. Please contact support@adyen.com and provide us CSR + merchant Identifier.
Apple Pay will only be visible if you are running on IOS10 and higher. You need to browse on a Safari browser and you need to have active credit cards in your wallet.

sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

merchant_identifier_test.label: Test: Apple Merchant Identifier

merchant_identifier_live.label: Live: Apple Merchant Identifier
merchant_identifier_live.tooltip: You can retrieve this from you Apple Account.

full_path_location_pem_file_test.label: Test: PEM File location
full_path_location_pem_file_test.tooltip: You need to generate a pem file from the apple certificate. You need to upload this to your webserver and define the full path location here.

full_path_location_pem_file_live.label: Live: PEM File location
full_path_location_pem_file_live.tooltip: You need to generate a pem file from the apple certificate. You need to upload this to your webserver and define the full path location here.

shipping_type.label: Shipping Type

allow_quest_checkout.label: Allow Guest Checkout
allow_quest_checkout.tooltip: Show Apple Pay icon if user is not logged in. The user has the option to set his own contact details and shipping\billing address.

change_address.label: Option to change address details in Apple Payment Sheet
change_address.tooltip: Do you want to offer the customer that is logged in to change his address in the Apple Payment Sheet?

show_in_payment_step_checkout.label: Show payment method as well in the Payment Information step of the checkout
show_in_payment_step_checkout.tooltip: If you set this to NO this will not be shown as a payment method option in the checkout steps. It will be visible on the product and shopping basket page.

show_outside_of_checkout.label: Show Apple buy button on product and cart page
show_outside_of_checkout.tooltip: Set this to 'no' if you have advanced options for, for example, shipping that are not supported by the Apple Pay checkout forcing the user to first go through the Magento Checkout
